The below list contains the tentative schedule and required 
readings for STAT 413/613 during Spring Semester 2019.

- Week 1:
    - Version Control with git.
    - Collaboration and software-hosting with GitHub.
    - [A Quick Introduction to Version Control with Git and GitHub](https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pcbi.1004668).
    - [Setting up GitHub Classroom](https://github.com/jfiksel/github-classroom-for-students)
- Week 2:
    - Manipulating dates and times with lubridate.
    - Chapter 16 of [RDS](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/).
- Week 3:
    - Manipulating Vectors and Lists using base R syntax.
    - Chapter 20 of [RDS](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/).
- Week 4: 
    - Learn about iteration.
    - Iterators in base R.
    - Iterators in purrr.
    - Chapter 21 of [RDS](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/).
- Week 6:
    - Midterm 1. 
    - Covers weeks 1 through 4.
- Weeks 5/7: 
    - Learn the basics of Shiny Apps.
    - Learn the basics of Shiny layouts.
    - Learn the basics reactivity and the the `server()` function in Shiny Apps.
    - Edit style of Shiny App with HTML elements.
    - Chapters 1, 2, 3, 4, and 13 of [Mastering Shiny](https://mastering-shiny.org/).
- Week 8/9: 
    - Review intermediate Statistics (STAT 302/320/614).
    - Probability distributions in R.
    - P-values/confidence intervals.
    - $t$-tests for means in R.
    - Proportion tests in R.
    - Skim OpenIntro book: <https://leanpub.com/openintro-statistics>
- Week 9/10:
    - Simple Linear Regression in R.
    - Use a list-column to run many models at once.
    - The broom package.
    - Chapter 25 from [RDS](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/).
    - Chapter 8 of [OpenIntro Statistics (Fourth Edition)](https://www.openintro.org/stat/textbook.php)
- Week 11:
    - Reading and manipulating large datasets in R.
    - `data.table` syntax for manipulating data frames.
    - [Introduction to data.table](https://cloud.r-project.org/web/packages/data.table/vignettes/datatable-intro.html).
- Week 12:
    - APIs and R.
    - Basics of Web Scraping
    - [Overview of rvest](https://rvest.tidyverse.org/).
- Week 13:
    - Midterm 2.
    - Covers weeks 5 through 11
- Week 14:
    - Learn how to create a website with R Markdown.
    - Create a personal or project website.
    - Chapter 1 and Section 3.1 of the [blogdown: Creating Websites with R Markdown](https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/)
- Final Exam Period:
    - Final project presentations.
